Mount Gahinga Lodge welcomes you to indulge in the country’s biodiversity, inviting you to explore the fruits of local conservation efforts. An adventure amidst the foothills of the Virunga mountains make the perfect close to this transformative safari.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Uganda - Welcome to Uganda! You will receive a warm welcome on arrival to Entebbe airport. Your journey begins as they whisk you away to the tranquil oasis of Hotel No. 5. This elegant retreat is the perfect place to rest and rejuvenate, with its serene atmosphere and understated luxury, offering a prelude to the wonders that lie ahead. Overnight at Hotel No. 5, where the sounds of nature and a delicious breakfast prepare you for the adventure of a lifetime.

From the Skies to the Mountains - Today, you'll rise with the sun and head to Entebbe Airport for a domestic flight over Uganda's breathtaking landscapes. As your plane touches down at Kasese airstrip, your expert guide will be waiting to lead you into the heart of Uganda’s pristine wilderness. En route to Kibale Lodge, stop at the Rwenzori Sculpture Foundation. Here, the creative spirit of Uganda's clans is celebrated through striking sculptures that echo the ancient traditions of the region. Arriving at Kibale Lodge, you’ll be greeted with panoramic views of the snow-dusted Rwenzori Mountains and the sprawling plains of Queen Elizabeth National Park. In the afternoon, visit a local school and witness the transformative work of the Roots and Shoots program, which fosters the development of women leaders in conservation. As the sun sets, relax with cocktails on the terrace, soaking in the majestic beauty of the Rwenzoris. Overnight at Kibale Lodge, where the wilderness whispers of the adventures to come.

Chimpanzees in the Kibale Forest - Rise early for an exhilarating trek into the Kibale Forest, the world-renowned Primate Capital. The air is thick with anticipation as you venture deep into the forest, where the chorus of hooting chimpanzees fills the canopy above. Suddenly, there they are—swinging gracefully between the trees, their energy palpable. Watching these intelligent creatures in their natural habitat is a moment that will stay with you forever. In the afternoon, wander through the Bigodi Wetland, a paradise for bird lovers and nature enthusiasts. With luck, you’ll spot the elusive Red Colobus monkeys or the Sitatunga antelope, as well as stunning birds like the Great Blue Turaco. Overnight at Kibale Lodge, where the magic of the forest lingers.

Exploring Kibale - Today offers another opportunity to connect with the captivating chimpanzees of Kibale. Each encounter is unique, and the forest is alive with possibilities. Keep your eyes peeled for the diverse wildlife that calls this jungle home, from the playful Olive Baboons to the delicate Bushbabies that peek out from the shadows. After lunch, visit the Sadhguru School, where education and conservation blend to shape Uganda’s future. As evening falls, the lodge’s peaceful setting invites you to relax and reflect on your incredible experiences. Overnight at Kibale Lodge, where adventure and serenity meet.

Journey at Kyambura - After a leisurely breakfast, your journey continues to Kyambura Gorge Lodge, perched on the edge of Queen Elizabeth National Park. As you travel through the park, keep your camera ready for sightings of lions, leopards, elephants, and the majestic Uganda kob. After lunch, set out on a hike along the Fig Tree Trail, descending into the mystical Kyambura Gorge. This deep, lush chasm feels like stepping into another world, where a small group of chimps—known as the ‘Lost Chimpanzees of Kyambura’—live in isolation. Though sightings can be unpredictable, the sheer beauty of the gorge is reward enough. On your return, review camera trap footage to uncover the nocturnal mysteries of the wildlife that roams the gorge. Overnight at Kyambura Gorge Lodge, where the day’s discoveries enrich your dreams.

Boat Cruise on the Kazinga - As dawn breaks over the savannah, embark on an early morning game drive through the Kasenyi plains. Lions stalk their prey, elephants move in majestic herds, and leopards prowl the scrubby thickets, waiting to be spotted. Accompanied by a member of the Kyambura Wildlife Team, you’ll learn about the crucial lion monitoring project that protects these iconic predators. In the afternoon, take to the water for a wildlife cruise along the Kazinga Channel. The waters teem with life—hippos bob lazily, while elephants and buffaloes gather at the shore to drink. End the day with cocktails on the lodge veranda, watching the sun dip behind the gorge, casting a golden glow over the landscape. Overnight at Kyambura Gorge Lodge, where the wild meets the luxurious.

Trek in the Kyambura Gorge - After a magical bush breakfast, lace up your hiking boots for a second trek into Kyambura Gorge. Beyond the search for chimpanzees, you’ll delve deeper into the secrets of this stunning ecosystem. Your guide will help you track footprints and share the stories of the wildlife that thrives here. Later, take part in the Kyambura Gorge Eco-tourism Project, where you can try your hand at coffee roasting with the Kyambura Women’s Coffee Cooperative or plant a tree in the wildlife buffer zone. As the day draws to a close, enjoy a BBQ and wildlife storytelling evening with the local community—a perfect blend of culture and conservation. Overnight at Kyambura Gorge Lodge, where the spirit of Uganda’s wilderness comes to life.

Arrival at Mount Gahinga Lodge - Fly to Kisoro and then journey by road to the breathtaking Mount Gahinga Lodge, nestled at the base of the Virunga Volcanoes. In the afternoon, visit the Gahinga Batwa Village and step into a world rich with history and tradition. The Batwa people, one of Africa’s oldest tribes, will share stories of their ancient life as forest-dwelling hunter-gatherers. Enjoy cocktails and a fireside chat with a vet from the Gorilla Doctors, learning about their tireless efforts to protect these endangered creatures. Overnight at Mount Gahinga Lodge, where the stars shine bright above the volcanoes.

Gorilla Trekking in Uganda - Today, you’ll set out for one of the most extraordinary experiences on Earth—gorilla trekking. The journey through steep, dense forests is challenging, but every step is worth it when you finally come face-to-face with a family of mountain gorillas. Watching these gentle giants in their natural habitat is a humbling and awe-inspiring experience. After a fulfilling day, return to the lodge and treat yourself to a rejuvenating Rungu massage at the Gahinga Spa. Overnight at Mount Gahinga Lodge, where relaxation follows adventure.

Exploring the Virunga Mountains - Your final full day in Uganda begins with a trek into the foothills of the Virunga mountains, in search of the playful and rare golden monkeys. Their vibrant fur and lively antics make them a joy to watch as they swing through the trees. In the afternoon, take time to relax and revisit the Batwa Heritage Trail to deepen your connection to the land and its people. Overnight at Mount Gahinga Lodge, where the serenity of the mountains soothes your soul.

Departure Home - As your adventure comes to a close, transfer to Kisoro airstrip for your return flight to Entebbe, carrying with you memories of unforgettable encounters with Uganda’s wildlife, landscapes, and people. Departure times align perfectly with international flights, allowing you to reflect on your incredible journey through this magical land.

tourName: Uganda highlights tour
generalInfo:
This 12-day adventure offers an unforgettable introduction to Uganda’s remarkable wildlife and landscapes. Journey from the savannahs of Murchison Falls and Queen Elizabeth National Park to the rainforests of Kibale and Bwindi, home to chimpanzees and endangered mountain gorillas.
Along the way, enjoy game drives, river cruises, and immersive cultural experiences, with time to unwind at scenic Lake Mutanda. The trip ends with a peaceful stay in Lake Mburo National Park, rounding off a journey rich in contrast, beauty and discovery.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Entebbe: On arrival in Entebbe, you’ll be welcomed by your private driver and transferred to a high-end hotel. Depending on your arrival time, you may wish to relax at the property or explore nearby highlights such as the Botanical Gardens, local craft markets, the Uganda Wildlife Education Centre, or take a sunset cruise on Lake Victoria.

Murchison Falls and Safari: Depart Entebbe this morning for a scenic five-hour drive to Murchison Falls National Park, Uganda’s largest and oldest conservation area. On arrival, settle into your lodge before heading out to explore the dramatic waterfall either on foot or by boat. The following day, enjoy a classic safari experience on the open plains, with chances to spot giraffe, lion, leopard, buffalo, hartebeest and Uganda kob. Then take a cruise along the Nile to the base of the falls, passing pods of hippo, Nile crocodiles and elephants on the riverbanks. The park also offers excellent birdwatching opportunities.

Chimpanzee Tracking: Depart Murchison Falls for a full-day journey south through Uganda’s scenic countryside, passing tea plantations and rolling hills en route to Fort Portal. Arrive in the afternoon and settle into your lodge near the edge of Kibale Forest, with views of the Rwenzori Mountains.The next morning, rise early for your chimpanzee tracking adventure. After a briefing with park rangers, head into the forest to search for chimpanzees. Their vocal calls often echo through the trees before you see them. Once located, you’ll spend an hour observing their behaviour in the wild. Kibale is also home to other primates, colourful butterflies and a wide variety of birdlife. In the afternoon, you may opt for a guided swamp walk through a nearby wetland, offering insights into local communities and opportunities to spot rare species in a striking natural setting.

Safari in Queen Elizabeth: After breakfast, depart Kibale and travel south to Queen Elizabeth National Park. Framed by the Rwenzori Mountains and bordered by Lakes Edward and George, this diverse landscape is home to savannah, wetlands and crater lakes. Settle into your lodge before heading out on an afternoon game drive, ending the day with a sundowner in the bush. The following day includes two game drives, offering excellent opportunities to spot elephants, lions, buffalo and a variety of antelope species. You can also take a boat cruise along the Kazinga Channel to observe hippos, crocodiles and prolific birdlife along the water's edge.

Gorilla Trekking: Travel southwest to Lake Mutanda, a picturesque region of rolling hills, volcanic peaks and freshwater lakes often referred to as "Little Switzerland." This is your base for gorilla trekking in Bwindi Impenetrable Forest and offers a peaceful setting for walking, canoeing, birdwatching and cultural encounters. On the second day, you'l set out early for your gorilla trek. After a briefing at the park headquarters, experienced guides will lead you through dense forest in search of one of the habituated gorilla families. Once located, you'll have one extraordinary hour to quietly observe these endangered primates in their natural habitat. It is a rare and humbling experience. There is also time to explore the surrounding area. We recommend the Batwa cultural experience, a guided walk with members of the Batwa community to learn about their forest-based traditions and history. Alternatively, you may choose to relax at your lodge or take a boat trip on Lake Mutanda.

Transfer to Lake Mburo: After breakfast, depart Lake Mutanda for the six-hour drive to Lake Mburo National Park. Although smaller than other parks, it offers varied landscapes and excellent wildlife viewing. Expect to see giraffe, zebra, buffalo, warthog, impala, hippo and crocodile, along with over 350 bird species. On arrival, enjoy a game drive through the park. Depending on your schedule, you may also have the option to explore on foot, by mountain bike or on a guided horse riding safari for a more immersive experience.

After breakfast, you’ll begin your journey back to Entebbe, arriving in time for your international flight home. As you leave Uganda, you’ll take with you unforgettable memories of its wildlife, landscapes and warm hospitality.

tourName: Uganda luxury safari and gorilla trek
generalInfo:
This 10 days exclusive luxury safari will take you to the best of what Uganda, the pearl of Africa offers. You will see lots of wildlife that include lions, elephants, African Cafe buffalo, lots of antelopes like the Uganda Kob among others. Go for a wildlife boat safari on the Kazinga channel in Queen Elizabeth National Park(one of the highlights) and of course the trekking mountain gorillas which we bet is the highlight of this safari and watching chimpanzees in their wild nature as well
You will stay in some of the most stunning luxury lodges

Highlights
-Game drives
-Gorilla and chimp tracking
-Boat safaris
-Tree climbing lions
-Stunning Luxury lodges

dayInfo.description: Arriving at the airport you will be warmly welcomed by a representative of Gorilla Link Tours, and transferred to your hotel Depending on the time of your arrival, you might be able to do some optional activities in Entebbe like a visit to the Botanical gardens Please note that all activities today are at your own cost. Journey Time: 20 minutes Accommodation: Hotel No.5 Meal Plan: No meals inclusive

Today after an early breakfast, your guide will come to your hotel to brief you about the safari and will transfer you to Fort portal, close to Kibale National park. The drive is incredibly scenic, passing through villages, lush green forests and hills dotted with tea plantations. You will stay at a wonderful lodge, just outside Fort Portal town, with spacious rooms and amazing views over one of the crater lakes in this area. Journey Time: 5 hours Accommodation: Kyaninga Lodge Meal plan: All meals

Today you will wake up early to go to the park head offices to be briefed about your chimp tracking experience. Kibale Forest National park boasts the highest number of primate species in the world, including the chimpanzees. Approximately 5,000 chimpanzees live in the wild in Uganda, which makes it a perfect place to see them An experienced ranger will take you chimp tracking chimp in the morning or afternoon; you might also see other monkey species that live here. Once you locate the chimpanzees you will have a full hour of eye-to-eye contact with them. Since they are wild animals, we can never guarantee you to see them and might have to settle with hearing their hoots and hollers. In the afternoon after lunch, you will go for the guided swamp walk. The walk (3-6 hours) will take you through grassland, small communities and some beautiful scenery, where the locals are likely to greet you with enthusiastic waves. It is usual to spot three to four different primate species during this walk, though the highlight is catching a glimpse of the great blue turaco! Journey Time: 20 minutes each way Accommodation: Kyaninga Lodge Meal Plane: All meals

After breakfast, your guide will drive you to Queen Elizabeth National Park, home to a high concentration of Uganda’s mammals that include tree climbing and savanna lions, elephants, wart hogs, Uganda kob, water buck, cape buffalo, hippos, leopards, as well as more than 600 species of birds that include the African spoon bill, pied kingfishers, fish eagles, pelicans, vultures Queen Elizabeth National park is Uganda’s second largest park, located at the base of the majestic Rwenzori Mountain range, adjacent to Lake Edward and Lake George. The park has game including Uganda kob, warthog and waterbuck. Lions are often sighted both in and at the entrance to the park. Be ready to see huge numbers of hippos and elephants, and keep your eyes on the look out for a leopard lazing in the sunshine. In the late afternoon you will relax at the lodge. Journey Time: 4 Accommodation: Elephant Plains Lodge Meal Plan: All meals

Today after breakfast, you will go for lion tracking tracking and a wildlife game drive. Lion tracking is for visitors who yearn to get up close to wild African fauna. This research trip is a rewarding adventure. This new and unique experience allows visitors to actively participate in monitoring some of lions in the park, using locator devices and learn habituation calls, as well as monitoring weather, surroundings and behavior. The results are added to researchers’ databases, contributing valuable information to the overall understanding of wildlife ecology - and helping to conserve this wonderful ecosystem. This will as well give you a 95% chance to see the lions. The number of people on each outing is limited in order to reduce stress on the animals. In the afternoon you will take a boat safari along the Kazinga Channel which joins Lake George and Lake Edward. Here, you will see a lot of hippos (more than you can possibly imagine!), as well as a variety of other animals which come to the waterhole to drink or bathe. You can expect to see buffalo, crocodile, bathing elephant, and a range of beautiful birds. This will undoubtedly be one of the highlights of your tour. Accommodation: Elephant Plains Lodge Meal Plan: All meals

After breakfast, you will be transferred to the southern part of Queen Elizabeth N.P; Ishasha sector which is famous for its tree-climbing lions. To escape from the heat during the day, the lions learned how to climb the fig trees. If you’re lucky you might spot a few during your afternoon game drive. After the game drive, you will be taken to Ishasha Wilderness Camp, a very nice and luxurious lodge with wonderful views over the savannah and a river packed with hippos. In the evening you will go for a sundowner. Journey Time: 3 hours by road Accommodation: Ishasha Wilderness camp Meal plan: All meals

Today morning you will go for another game drive for a chance to see the tree climbing lions. After lunch at Ishasha Wilderness Camp you will be transferred to Bwindi Impenetrable Forest, home of the mountain gorillas. You will stay in a very luxurious lodge with stunning views of Bwindi Forest Journey Time: 4 hours to Bwindi Accommodation: Buhoma Lodge Meal plan: All meals

Today after early breakfast, you will be transferred to the park head quarters for briefing about gorilla tracking. You will encounter one of Bwindi’s endangered mountain gorillas. For most people this is the absolute highlight of their tour in Uganda. Bwindi Impenetrable national park boasts both mountain gorillas and chimpanzees - the only forest in Africa that can make this claim. It also hosts five other species of primates, 113 species of mammals, over 200 species of butterflies and 360 species of birds. The gorillas you track are habituated and can tolerate the presence of humans for a brief period of time, every day. The time taken to track the gorillas can be as few as 2 hours to as many as 7 hours. Once the gorillas have been located, your group will be allowed a maximum of one hour with them. Coming face-to-face with a mountain gorilla is a truly humbling and emotional experience. This is a fantastic and privileged opportunity to get up close and personal with Uganda’s very own ‘Gorillas in the Mist’. Accommodation: Buhoma Lodge Meal plan: All meals

After breakfast, you will travel to Lake Mburo National Park, one of Uganda’s smallest parks, but certainly not to be underestimated. It is the only Ugandan national park (besides to Kidepo Valley N.P.) which is home to zebras, elands and impalas, as well as to an abundance of other wildlife - not to mention the lake itself, which has lots of hippos and crocodiles. Last but not least: The Uganda Wildlife Authority recently brought 15 giraffes from Murchison falls to lake Mburo (1st July 2015)! Journey time: 5 hours Accommodation: Mihingo Lodge Meal plan: All meals

Today after breakfast, you will go for a guided bush walk in Lake Mburo National Park. Lake Mburo N.P is one of two parks in Uganda where bush walks with an experienced ranger are permitted. This opportunity should not be missed. From footprints and animal droppings the ranger will be able to tell you which animal has left it and how long ago. It is exciting to approach wildlife at such close range. Note: Instead of going for the bush walk, you can go on a horseback riding safari in the park (US $60 p.p. extra for 2 hours). After, you will drive back to Kampala or Entebbe (Airport) stopping at the equator for the requisite snapshot and a bit of souvenir shopping. Accommodation for tonight is not inclusive in the program. If you wish to depart tonight from Entebbe Airport, make sure your flight is at 10 pm or later. If you want us to book one (or more) nights in Kampala and/or Entebbe, please let us know. Journey Time: 5 hours to Entebbe Accommodation: Not included Meal plan: Breakfast and lunch

tourName: Uganda photography tour
generalInfo:
Join us for an unforgettable photography journey through Uganda, an adventure brimming with stunning landscapes, diverse wildlife, and rich cultural history. This carefully curated itinerary takes you deep into Uganda's national parks and reserves, offering fantastic chances to photograph some of Africa's most iconic animals in their natural environments.

From the roaring Murchison Falls to the mist-shrouded forests of Bwindi, we will track endangered mountain gorillas, look for the elusive shoebill, and capture shots of tree-climbing lions relaxing in the branches of Ishasha. Expect breathtaking sunrises over the savannahs, golden light streaming through thick jungles, and intimate encounters with various big game, primates, and birds. Whether you're an experienced photographer or simply have a love for wildlife and nature, this tour is crafted to immerse you in the unspoiled beauty of Uganda's wilderness, guaranteeing you leave with a collection of stunning photos and cherished memories.

dayInfo.description: We arrive at Entebbe International Airport and transfer to our hotel. In the afternoon, we visit the Entebbe Botanical Gardens, a great spot to photograph monkeys, birds, and lush flora. Alternatively, we can see the Mabamba Swamps to search for the shoebill. In the evening, we have a welcome dinner at a local restaurant.

Following breakfast, we drive through the suburbs of Kampala to reach Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary, arriving just in time for lunch. In the afternoon, we embark on a safari walk to capture photographs of rhinos in their natural habitat. We enjoy dinner and spend the night at Ziwa Rhino Lodge.

As dawn breaks, we set off in canoes to seek out the shoebill stork. Following this adventure, we head back to our lodge for breakfast before embarking on a drive to Murchison Falls National Park. We make a stop to hike to the falls' summit for scenic views of the Nile. Once we check into our lodge, we venture out for an afternoon game drive, on the lookout for giraffes, lions, elephants, and other wildlife.

We begin the day with an early morning game drive, aiming to encounter wildlife like leopards, hartebeests, and oribis. We'll also stop by a hippo pool. Murchison Falls hosts an array of bird species, including bee-eaters and hornbills. In the afternoon, a private boat cruise takes us to the foot of the falls, where we can photograph both the waterfall and the wildlife along the riverbanks. As the day wraps up, we embark on another game drive.

Today, we embark on a picturesque drive to Kibale Forest, renowned for its chimpanzee conservation initiatives. During our journey, we will pass by Lake Albert and quaint villages, pausing for photos whenever possible. We'll arrive at our lodge in the late afternoon.

Following breakfast, we embark on chimpanzee tracking in Kibale Forest, spending the morning observing and photographing these fascinating primates. The trails in the forest are flat and easily navigable. After lunch, we head to Queen Elizabeth National Park, arriving just in time for a sunset photography session.

We begin our day at Queen Elizabeth National Park with an early morning game drive. This park is inhabited by elephants, lions that climb trees, and a variety of bird species. We might stop by the saline lakes for photographs of flamingos. Later in the afternoon, we enjoy a private boat cruise along the Kazinga Channel, where we can capture images of buffalo, elephants, hippos, and birds.

We journey to Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, with a pause in Ishasha to seek out tree-climbing lions. After capturing photos of these extraordinary animals, we proceed to Bwindi, stopping at a local primary school to engage with teachers and students and discover more about daily life in Uganda.

After breakfast, we board a domestic flight back to Entebbe. When we arrive, we can choose to visit the Uganda Wildlife Conservation Education Centre. In the evening, we savor a farewell dinner at a local restaurant.
Following breakfast, we head to Entebbe International Airport for our departing flights, concluding our photography tour in Uganda.

tourName: Uganda primate safari and wildlife holiday
generalInfo:
Uganda is known for its friendly people and the diverse landscapes and activities. This 12 days trip will show you the best of all the goodness the country has to offer. It features grassland Savannah with wildlife and a guided bush walking safari

Highlights
• Rhino tracking
• Safaris on the Savannah
• Chimpanzees in the tropical forests
• 2 Boat safaris
• Tracking the rare mountain gorillas
• Best mid range accommodations in Uganda

dayInfo.description: Entebbe – Kampala: Travel Time: 42 km, 1 hour Arriving at the airport you will be warmly welcomed by a representative and transferred to your hotel in Entebbe Journey Time: 1 hour Accommodation: Le Petite Village Meal Plan: No meals inclusive

Entebbe – Murchison Falls National Park via Ziwa Rhino sanctuary. Today after breakfast, your guide will pick you from Kampala to Murchison Falls NP. En route, you will visit Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary where you will go for a game walk with an experienced ranger, which gives you a unique opportunity to view the rhinos from a close distance. Murchison Falls and Kidepo Valley National Parks once had both black and white rhinos; however, widespread poaching during the Idi Amin era resulted in the disappearance of these majestic animals from the wild. Founded in 1998, Rhino Fund Uganda works to reintroduce black and white rhinos into Uganda and runs a breeding programme. Murchison Falls National Park is the largest conservation area in Uganda, covering an area of over 3,840 km². The park’s name derives from its famous waterfall: the mighty Murchison Falls, which are formed where the Victoria Nile powerfully forces its way through a narrow cleft before plunging 43m down with a thunderous roar The mighty Nile River divides the park into its north and south sections. At the spectacular Murchison Falls the world's longest river explodes violently through a narrow cleft in the Rift Valley escarpment to plunge into a frothing pool 43m below. As the river attracts large numbers of game, a boat safari up the Nile provides the perfect opportunity to see and photograph the animals. Carefully watched by crocodiles, hundreds of hippos, buffaloes, water birds, apes and all the other thirsty wildlife that the Nile attracts; you go to the bottom of the Murchison Falls, which approaches you with a thunderous sound. By car or after a short hike you can reach the “Top of the falls” from where you have a perfect view of the impressive falls and the river snaking below. You will be staying at a great mid range lodge. Here you can relax during the rest of your day. Journey Time: 7 hours Accommodation: Pakuba Safari Lodge Meal Plan: All meals

Morning game drive- Afternoon boat safari-Top of falls Today after breakfast, you will depart for an early morning game drive across the rolling plains of Uganda’s largest National Park. The 3,893 sq km park is home to a range of animals, and you will have a chance of viewing some of the Park’s residents including lions, giraffes, hartebeest, buffalo, and elephants. For the birders amongst you, these areas support the secretary bird and the black chested snake eagle, to name a few. In the afternoon, go for a boat trip to the base of Murchison Falls, where the Nile thunders through a small 7 meter gap plunging 43 meters into the Nile on the way to Lake Albert. The banks of the Nile are densely populated with crocodiles, hippopotamus, and a range of other wildlife that come to the river to drink. After the boat safari you will hike to the top of the falls. From here you have a wonderful view and fantastic photo opportunities! Accommodation: Pakuba Safari Lodge Meal Plan: All meals Optional activities: 1. Night Game drive If staying in the northern part of the park, you can go for a night game drive, with your safari guide and a ranger guide from Uganda Wildlife Authority. The night game drives may start from 4pm returning at 10pm latest. A spotlight is used to spot the different animals. Night game drives offer a whole new perspective to a Uganda safari and allows travellers to experience the mysteries of the African bush after dark. Travellers will get a chance to see the nocturnal life such as porcupines, mongoose, leopards and other animals that love the dark. Costing: 120 USD per vehicle 2. Hot air balloon safari Discover Murchison Falls from the air and enjoy the unique experience of flying over Murchison Falls NP in a hot air balloon. You will have the most amazing views over the river Nile, Lake Albert, the great Murchison Falls and of course this is the best way to spot lots and lots of animals. You will start early morning, so you will see the sun rise over the park. After your balloon safari you will have a bush breakfast in the park (inclusive). Costing: $380 us dollar p.p.

Transfer to Kibale National Park Today you will begin your journey to Kibale Forest N.P. The long drive is incredibly scenic, passing through tea plantations and the lush green countryside which characterizes so much of Uganda. Kibale Forest National Park is located in west-central Uganda just east of the Rwenzori Mountains, near the town of Fort Portal. The 766 Km² Park predominantly covers evergreen rain forest and ranges between 1100 and 1600m in elevation. Kibale Forest is one of the last remaining expanses to contain both lowland and montane forests and forms a continuous forest with Queen Elizabeth National Park. You will have packed lunch en route, arriving in the evening for overnight and dinner Journey Time: 7 hours Accommodation: Primate Lodge- Kibale Meal Plan: All meals

Chimpanzee tracking – Bigodi swamp walk Today you will wake up early to go to the park head offices to be briefed about your chimp tracking experience. Kibale Forest National park boasts the highest number of primate species in the world, including the chimpanzees. Approximately 5,000 chimpanzees live in the wild in Uganda, which makes it a perfect place to see them An experienced ranger will take you chimp tracking chimp in the morning or afternoon; you might also see other monkey species that live here. Once you locate the chimpanzees you will have a full hour of eye-to-eye contact with them. Since they are wild animals, we can never guarantee you to see them and might have to settle with hearing their hoots and hollers. In the afternoon after lunch, you will go for the guided swamp walk. The walk (2-3 hours) will take you through grassland, small communities and some beautiful scenery, where the locals are likely to greet you with enthusiastic waves. It is usual to spot three to four different primate species during this walk, though the highlight is catching a glimpse of the great blue turaco. Journey Time: 15 minutes each way Accommodation: Primate Lodge Kibale- Standard cottages Meal Plane: All meals

Transfer to Queen Elizabeth National Park In the morning, you can relax at your lodge. You will then continue your journey to Queen Elizabeth National park. Queen Elizabeth National park is Uganda’s second largest park, located at the base of the majestic Rwenzori Mountain range, adjacent to Lake Edward and Lake George. The park has game including Uganda kob, warthog and waterbuck. Lions are often sighted both in and at the entrance to the park. Be ready to see huge numbers of hippos and elephants, and keep your eyes on the look out for a leopard lazing in the sunshine. In the late afternoon you will relax at the lodge. You will stay in a nice lodge, overlooking Queen Elizabeth National park. Journey Time: 4 hours Accommodation: Twin Lakes Safari Lodge Meal Plan: All meals

Game drive & Kazinga channel boat safari Today you wake up early and have breakfast. You will search for all the wildlife in the park and are likely to come across Elephant, Buffalo, Lion, Waterbuck, Leopard, Uganda Kob, and many Warthogs. In the afternoon after lunch, you will take a boat safari along the Kazinga Channel which joins Lake George and Lake Edward. Here, you will see a lot of hippos (more than you can possibly imagine!), as well as a variety of other animals which come to the waterhole to drink or bathe. You can expect to see buffalo, crocodile, bathing elephant, and a range of beautiful birds. This will undoubtedly be one of the highlights of your tour. After the boat-safari you game drive back to the lodge. Accommodation: Twin Lakes Safari Lodge Meal Plan: All meals

Transfer to Ishasha sector After breakfast you will proceed to the southern part of Queen Elizabeth National Park, the famous Ishasha area, for a game drive searching for the tree climbing lions Ishasha is home to the famous tree-climbing lions. While lion cubs around the world frequently climb trees for fun, adults rarely do. The (adult) lions in Ishasha are an exception to this. It is thought that they sit in the branches to get away from the tsetse flies and to enjoy a cool breeze. If you are lucky you might spot a few during your game drive. You will overnight at Enjojo Lodge, which is surrounded with acacia forest, lush vegetation with palm trees and scattered grasslands. Find birds, monkeys, and other wildlife around your cottage. Journey Time: 2 hours Accommodation: Enjojo Lodge Meal plan: All meals

Transfer to Bwindi Today after breakfast, you will be transferred to Lake Mutanda in the south-western part of Uganda; close to the borders with Rwanda and Congo. You will see a great country-side, bamboo forest and have great views over the Virunga Mountains. For lunch you will stop at a local restaurant on the road Journey Time: 6 hours Accommodation: Mutanda Lake Resort Meal plan: All meals

Gorilla Tracking in Bwindi Forest Today after early breakfast, you will be transferred to the park head quarters for briefing about gorilla tracking. You will encounter one of Bwindi’s endangered mountain gorillas. For most people this is the absolute highlight of their tour in Uganda. Bwindi Impenetrable national park boasts both mountain gorillas and chimpanzees - the only forest in Africa that can make this claim. It also hosts five other species of primates, 113 species of mammals, over 200 species of butterflies and 360 species of birds. The gorillas you track are habituated and can tolerate the presence of humans for a brief period of time, every day. The time taken to track the gorillas can be as few as 2 hours to as many as 7 hours. Once the gorillas have been located, your group will be allowed a maximum of one hour with them. Coming face-to-face with a mountain gorilla is a truly humbling and emotional experience. This is a fantastic and privileged opportunity to get up close and personal with Uganda’s very own ‘Gorillas in the Mist’. Journey Time: 45 minutes each way Accommodation: Mutanda Lake Resort Meal plan: All meals Optional Activities: Gorilla Habituation- 1500 USD per permit (You must stay in Rushaga, Southern Sector of Bwindi) Gorilla habituation is a new activity that Uganda Wildlife Authority has opened up for travellers in Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park. Gorilla habituation can only be done in Uganda, in Rushaga which is the southern sector of the park for $1500 a gorilla habituation permit There are two gorilla family groups that are being habituated and one can be part of that habituation program with researchers from Uganda Wildlife Authority. Instead of 8 people as is the case of gorilla tracking, only 4 people are allowed to participate in the gorilla habituation. You will spend 4 hours with the gorilla family being habituated from the time you find where they nested the previous night; learning about their behaviours and so on. Your data collected will be added into the data base and even when you go back home and are still interested in updates about the gorilla family you habituated, they will be availed to you. The activity begins at 7am, with a team of trackers, researchers and ranger guides.

Transfer to Lake Mburo National Park After breakfast, you will travel to Lake Mburo National Park, one of Uganda’s smallest parks, but certainly not to be underestimated. It is the only Ugandan national park (besides to Kidepo Valley N.P.) which is home to zebras, elands and impalas, as well as to an abundance of other wildlife - not to mention the lake itself, which has lots of hippos and crocodiles. Last but not least: The Uganda Wildlife Authority recently brought 15 giraffes from Murchison falls to lake Mburo (1st July 2015)! You will stay just outside the park boundaries, but it will feel like being in the middle of the park. From your veranda and restaurant you have a great view over the park and its wildlife. Journey time: 7 hours Accommodation: Rwakobo Rock Meal plan: All meals

Guided bush walk and transfer to Kampala or Entebbe Today after breakfast, you will go for a guided bush walk. Lake Mburo N.P is one of two parks in Uganda where bush walks with an experienced ranger are permitted. This opportunity should not be missed. From footprints and animal droppings the ranger will be able to tell you which animal has left it and how long ago. It is exciting to approach wildlife at such close range. After, you will drive back to Kampala or Entebbe (Airport) stopping at the equator for the requisite snapshot and a bit of souvenir shopping. Accommodation for tonight is not inclusive in the program. If you wish to depart tonight from Entebbe Airport, make sure your flight is at 10 pm or later. If you want us to book one (or more) nights in Kampala and/or Entebbe, please let us know. Journey Time: 5 hours to Kampala, 6 hours to Entebbe Accommodation: Not included Meal plan: Breakfast and lunch

tourName: Uganda safari activity adventure
generalInfo:
This 12-day Safari of Eastern and Northern Uganda takes you on an enriching journey of adventure and discovery.

Immerse yourself in an array of activities that will stimulate your senses, from white-water rafting in the Nile to exploring the majestic waterfalls of Sipi. You will go to Jinja, Sipi, Pian Upe, Kidepo as well as Murchison Falls.

Beyond the breathtaking scenery and magnificent wildlife, you will have a unique opportunity to experience the rich culture of the local people and gain insight into their way of life. This safari is perfect for both small and large groups, with an array of activities to cater to different preferences.

Take a closer look at the detailed itinerary to get a clearer idea of what it would feel like for you. Also, keep in mind that all our trips can be tailored to meet your specific needs.

dayInfo.description: Our driver/guide will be waiting at Entebbe International Airport to pick you up and then transfer you to your accommodation for the night. Accommodation: 2 Friends Beach Hotel Meal Plan: Dinner

Early in the morning, after your breakfast, you will be driven to Jinja for a white-water rafting experience which can either take a full day or half-day depending on your choice. This is one of the most exciting rafting trips on earth – going up to 31 km and includes a fantastic barbeque lunch and complimentary drinks after the trip. Accommodation: Jinja Nile Resort Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

After breakfast, you will depart for Sipi Falls, which is located in the Eastern part of Uganda. The journey takes about 4-5 hours and you will have the opportunity to enjoy the scenic views of the countryside. Accommodation: Rafiki Lodge Sipi Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Today, you will hike to the three different waterfalls that make up Sipi Falls. The hike is moderate and takes about 3-4 hours. Along the way, you will pass through villages and farmland, giving you a chance to interact with the locals. Accommodation: Rafiki Lodge Sipi Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

After breakfast, you will depart for Pian Upe Game Reserve with packed lunch. You will have the opportunity to enjoy the scenic views of the countryside and game drives in the reserve. Pian Upe is one of the largest and most remote game reserves in Uganda and is home to a wide variety of wildlife including giraffes, buffalos, leopards, and cheetahs. In the evening, you will be driven to Moroto where you will have dinner and an overnight stay. Accommodation: Kara-Tunga, Karamoja Safari Camp Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

After breakfast, you will depart for Matheniko Game Reserve, which is located in the Karamoja region of Uganda. The journey takes about 5-6 hours and you will have the opportunity to enjoy the scenic views of the countryside. The reserve is home to a wide variety of wildlife including giraffes, zebras, and antelopes. Accommodation: Adere Safari Camp Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Today, you will go on a game drive in Kidepo Valley National Park. The park is home to a wide variety of wildlife including lions, elephants, buffaloes, zebras, and giraffes. Accommodation: Adere Safari Camp Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

After breakfast, you will go on a guided nature walk/hike in the Narus Valley, which is known for its scenic views and bird species. In the afternoon, you will visit a local Karamojong community and learn about their culture and way of life. Accommodation: Adere Safari Camp Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

After breakfast, you will depart for Murchison Falls National Park. The journey takes about 7-8 hours and you will have the opportunity to enjoy the scenic views of the countryside. Murchison Falls National Park is the largest park in Uganda and is known for its stunning waterfalls and diverse wildlife. Accommodation: Pakuba Safari Lodge Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

Early morning, your guide will take you for a wildlife safari game drive on the northern bank of the river Nile. Here, you will spot Elephants, Lions, Cape buffalo, Rothschild’s giraffe, hartebeest, Waterbuck, Oribi, Bushbuck, Bohor reedbuck, hyena, and if you are lucky, the leopard. You will return to your lodge for breakfast, rest, and lunch before heading out for the afternoon boat cruise. The boat cruise takes you upstream on the calm Victoria Nile to the base of the falls stopping just a few meters from the “Devil’s Cauldron”. While on the boat cruise, you will have a chance to marvel at the hippos floating in the water, and crocodiles as well as elephants, waterbuck, Uganda kob, and many other animals over this 19 km stretch of the Nile. For bird-watching enthusiasts, there are many chances of seeing bird species like the Goliath heron, Egyptian goose, Brown pelican, Red-throated bee-eater, various kingfishers, Fish eagles, cormorant, and the rare shoebill stork. After the boat cruise, you will return to your accommodation. Accommodation: Pakuba Safari Lodge Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner

After breakfast, you will hike to the top of Murchison Falls, which is a breathtaking sight. You will then transfer back to Entebbe with a stopover at Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary for Rhino Tracking. You will spend the evening relaxing at your hotel. Accommodation: 2 Friends Beach Resort Meal Plan: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner
After breakfast, you will be transferred to Entebbe International Airport for your departure flight. Accommodation: None Meal Plan: Breakfast

tourName: Uganda safari holiday, gorillas, chimps and lions
generalInfo:
This 10 days gorillas, chimps and lions wildlife safari will take you to the most popular national parks in Uganda. It will combine a classic wildlife safari in Murchison Falls National park and Queen Elizabeth National park. Classic wildlife safari activities include sunrise game drives, boat safaris, and primate trekking activities that include gorilla and chimpanzee trekking in Bwindi Impenetrable National Park and Kibale National park respectively.
The safari will combine nature, culture, animals and so much fun, all guided by a professional local safari driver guide who will be with you throughout the safari

Highlights
Gorilla Trekking
Chimpanzee Trekking
Game drives
Boat safaris at the bottom of Murchison falls and Kazinga Channel
Hike to the top of the Murchison Falls
Beautiful midrange accommodation
Friendly people

dayInfo.description: Your guide will be at Entebbe Airport to pick you up from your flight and take you directly to your lodge. Depending on the time of your arrival, you may be able to explore the sites in and Entebbe Journey Time: 10 minutes Accommodation: Boma Guest House Meal Plan: No meals inclusive

Today's journey will take you north from Kampala to Murchison falls national park. En route, you will visit Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary where you will go for guided rhino tracking with an experienced ranger, which gives you a unique opportunity to view the rhinos from a close distance. Kidepo Valley and Murchison Falls National Parks once had both black and white rhinos; however, widespread poaching during the Idi Amin era resulted in the disappearance of these majestic animals from the wild. Founded in 1998, Rhino Fund Uganda works to reintroduce black and white rhinos into Uganda and runs a breeding programme. Murchison Falls National Park is the largest conservation area in Uganda covering an area of over 3,840 km², The Park’s name derives from its famous waterfall: the mighty Murchison Falls, which are formed where the Victoria Nile powerfully forces its way through a narrow cleft before plunging 43m down with a thunderous roar The mighty Nile River divides the park into its north and south sections. At the spectacular Murchison Falls the world's longest river explodes violently through a narrow cleft in the Rift Valley escarpment to plunge into a frothing pool 43m below. As the river attracts large numbers of game, a boat safari up the Nile provides the perfect opportunity to see and photograph the animals. You will be watched by crocodiles, hundreds of hippos, buffaloes, water birds, monkeys and all the other thirsty wildlife that the Nile attracts, you go to the bottom of the Murchison Falls, which approaches you with a thunderous sound. By car or after a short hike you can reach the “Top of the falls” from where you have a perfect view of the extraordinary falls and the river snaking below. You will be staying at a great mid-range lodge, overlooking the River Nile. Journey Time: 6 Hours Accommodation: Murchison River Lodge Meal plan: All meals

Morning game drive, Boat safari & Hike to the top of falls Today you will wake up very early. In the early morning hours animals are the most active, the sun is not yet so bright and temperatures are cooler. It offers the best time to spot wild animals. After an early breakfast you will go on a game drive to explore the northern part of the park. You will be eye-to-eye with the African animals like elephants, giraffes, buffaloes, lions, leopards, different species of antelopes and many tropical birds may all be spotted during the game drive. So keep your eyes open. In the afternoon you will take a boat safari up the Nile River to Murchison Falls. You will be watched by crocodiles, hundreds of hippos, buffaloes, water birds, monkeys and all the other thirsty wildlife that the Nile attracts, you will reach the base of the 43-meter high Falls which approach with a thunderous sound. After the boat safari you will hike to the top of the falls. From here you will have a wonderful view and fantastic photo opportunities. Accommodation: Murchison River Lodge Meal plan: All meals

Today you will begin your journey to Kibale Forest N.P. The long drive is incredibly scenic, passing through tea plantations and the lush green countryside which characterizes so much of Uganda. Kibale Forest National Park is located in west-central Uganda just east of the Rwenzori Mountains, near the town of Fort Portal. The 766 Km² Park predominantly covers evergreen rain forest and ranges between 1100 and 1600m in elevation. Kibale Forest is one of the last remaining expanses to contain both lowland and montane forests and forms a continuous forest with Queen Elizabeth National Park. You will have packed lunch en route, arriving in the evening for overnight and dinner Journey Time: 7 hours Accommodation: Turaco Tree Tops Meal Plan: All meals

Chimpanzee tracking – Transfer to Queen Elizabeth NP Today you will wake up early to go to the park head offices to be briefed about your chimp tracking experience. Kibale Forest National Park boasts the highest number of primate species in the world, including the chimpanzees. Approximately 5,000 chimpanzees live in the wild in Uganda, which makes it a perfect place to see them An experienced ranger will take you chimp tracking chimp in the morning or afternoon; you might also see other monkey species that live here. Once you locate the chimpanzees you will have a full hour of eye-to-eye contact with them. Since they are wild animals, we can never guarantee you to see them and might have to settle with hearing their hoots and hollers. In the afternoon, after chimpanzee trekking, your guide will drive you to Queen Elizabeth National Park, home to a high concentration of Uganda’s mammals that include tree climbing and savanna lions, elephants, wart hogs, Uganda kob, water buck, cape buffalo, hippos, leopards, as well as more than 600 species of birds that include the African spoon bill, pied kingfishers, fish eagles, pelicans, vultures. Queen Elizabeth National park is Uganda’s second largest park, located at the base of the majestic Rwenzori Mountain range, adjacent to Lake Edward and Lake George. The park has game including Uganda kob, warthog and waterbuck. Lions are often sighted both in and at the entrance to the park. Be ready to see huge numbers of hippos and elephants, and keep your eyes on the look out for a leopard lazing in the sunshine. In the late afternoon you will relax at the lodge. Journey Time: 3 and a half hours Accommodation: Twin Lakes Safari Lodge Meal Plan: All meals

Game drive & Kazinga channel boat safari Today you wake up early and have breakfast. You will search for all the wildlife in the park and are likely to come across Elephant, Buffalo, Lion, Waterbuck, Leopard, Uganda Kob, and many Warthogs. In the afternoon you will take a boat safari along the Kazinga Channel which joins Lake George and Lake Edward. Here, you will see a lot of hippos (more than you can possibly imagine!), as well as a variety of other animals which come to the waterhole to drink or bathe. You can expect to see buffalo, crocodile, bathing elephant, and a range of beautiful birds. This will undoubtedly be one of the highlights of your tour. After the boat-safari you game drive back to the lodge. Accommodation: Twin Lakes Safari Lodge Meal Plan: All meals

Transfer to Bwindi Impenetrable Forest Today after breakfast, you will be transferred to Lake Mutanda in the south-western part of Uganda; close to the borders with Rwanda and Congo. You cross a beautiful part of the country often referred to as ‘the Switzerland of Africa’. You will see a great country-side, bamboo forest and have great views over the Virunga Mountains. For lunch you will stop at a local restaurant on the road Journey Time: 7 hours Accommodation: Mutanda Lake Resort Meal plan: All meals

Gorilla Tracking in Bwindi Forest Today after early breakfast, you will be transferred to the park head quarters for briefing about gorilla tracking. You will encounter one of Bwindi’s endangered mountain gorillas. For most people this is the absolute highlight of their tour in Uganda. Bwindi Impenetrable national park boasts both mountain gorillas and chimpanzees - the only forest in Africa that can make this claim. It also hosts five other species of primates, 113 species of mammals, over 200 species of butterflies and 360 species of birds. The gorillas you track are habituated and can tolerate the presence of humans for a brief period of time, every day. The time taken to track the gorillas can be as few as 2 hours to as many as 7 hours. Once the gorillas have been located, your group will be allowed a maximum of one hour with them. Coming face-to-face with a mountain gorilla is a truly humbling and emotional experience. This is a fantastic and privileged opportunity to get up close and personal with Uganda’s very own ‘Gorillas in the Mist’. Journey Time: 1 hour each way Accommodation: Mutanda Lake Resort Meal plan: All meals

Transfer to Lake Mburo National Park After breakfast, you will travel to Lake Mburo National Park, one of Uganda’s smallest parks, but certainly not to be underestimated. It is the only Ugandan national park (besides to Kidepo Valley N.P.) which is home to zebras, elands and impalas, as well as to an abundance of other wildlife - not to mention the lake itself, which has lots of hippos and crocodiles. Last but not least: The Uganda Wildlife Authority recently brought 15 giraffes from Murchison falls to lake Mburo (1st July 2015)! You will stay just outside the park boundaries, but it will feel like being in the middle of the park. From your veranda and restaurant, you have a great view over the park and its wildlife. Journey time: 5 hours Accommodation: Rwakobo Rock Meal plan: All meals

Guided bush walk and transfer to Entebbe Today after breakfast, you will go for a guided bush walk. Lake Mburo N.P is one of two parks in Uganda where bush walks with an experienced ranger are permitted. This opportunity should not be missed. From footprints and animal droppings the ranger will be able to tell you which animal has left it and how long ago. It is exciting to approach wildlife at such close range. Note: Instead of going for the bush walk, you can go on a horseback riding safari in the park (US $60 p.p. extra for 2 hours). After, you will drive back to Kampala or Entebbe (Airport) stopping at the equator for the requisite snapshot and a bit of souvenir shopping. Accommodation for tonight is not inclusive in the program. If you wish to depart tonight from Entebbe Airport, make sure your flight is at 10 pm or later. If you want us to book one (or more) nights in Kampala and/or Entebbe, please let us know. Journey Time: 5 hours to Entebbe Accommodation: Not included Meal plan: Breakfast and lunch

tourName: Uganda safari, tailor made
generalInfo:
This exceptional itinerary presents an opportunity to experience Uganda’s most captivating highlights without enduring long, tiresome drives. Begin your journey with an overnight stay in Entebbe, where you can relax and prepare for the adventures ahead. The next day, a short flight will take you to Queen Elizabeth National Park, famed for its diverse wildlife and striking landscapes. Here, you’ll embark on thrilling game drives, spotting elephants, buffalos, and an array of birdlife, as well as enjoy scenic boat safaris along the Kazinga Channel, where hippos, crocodiles, and numerous water birds await.

From there, a scenic drive brings you to the Ishasha sector, renowned for its rare and iconic tree-climbing lions – a true photographic delight. Next, venture to the lush Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, one of the last remaining strongholds of the endangered mountain gorilla. Prepare for an unforgettable experience as you trek through dense forests, guided by expert rangers, to encounter these magnificent creatures up close, an experience that leaves an indelible mark on the heart.

To round off your adventure, you’ll fly to Murchison Falls National Park, Uganda’s largest and oldest conservation area, for a unique safari experience. Here, marvel at the dramatic waterfall, where the mighty Nile River forces its way through a narrow gorge, creating a stunning display of power and beauty. You’ll enjoy game drives and a river safari, offering a chance to spot species such as giraffes, lions, and perhaps the elusive shoebill stork. Finally, return to Entebbe for your international departure, carrying with you memories of Uganda's extraordinary landscapes and wildlife encounters.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Entebbe - Upon arrival in Entebbe, you'll be collected by your guide and transferred to your hotel. Depending on your arrival time, you may be able to explore Entebbe and the surrounding areas in Kampala this afternoon. You can chose to have dinner at the hotel or we can recommend good spots for food and drink around town.

Fly to Queen Elizabeth National Park - After breakfast, you’ll fly from Entebbe to Queen Elizabeth National Park at the base of the Rwenzori Mountain range, adjacent to Lake Edward and Lake George. This spectacular national park is full of game and it is known for its large elephant population.

Safari in Queen Elizabeth National Park - Today, you’ll have a full day to explore Queen Elizabeth National Park. You’ll have morning and afternoon game drives, plus you can also enjoy a boat cruise on the Kazinga Channel, a guided nature walk in the Maramagambo Forest or you can take an early morning hot air balloon flight over the savannah.

Transfer to Ishasha - After breakfast, you’ll embark on a drive to Kyambura Gorge in the far eastern corner of Queen Elizabeth National Park. Kyambura Gorge is often referred to as the “Valley of Apes” and during your guided walk you can expect to see chimpanzees, red-tailed monkeys, vervet monkeys, olive baboons, and black and white colobus monkeys. You’ll then drive on to Ishasha, where you can look out for the famous tree climbing lions. The lodge where you’ll stay tonight is surrounded by wildlife and has stunning views of the lush forest.

Transfer to Bwindi - Today, you'll drive for three hours into the Virunga Mountains. You will be staying in Bwindi National Park, the only park in Africa that is home to both gorillas and chimpanzees. There are also a further 110 species of mammal and 360 species of birds.

Gorilla Trekking in Bwindi - After an early breakfast, you’ll drive to Bwindi Impenetrable National Park HQ, where you’ll begin your gorilla trek. You will be allocated to one of nine habituated groups, then your experienced guide and park ranger will lead you deep into the forest in search of your allocated family. Your trek could last from a few minutes to a full day, depending on the exact location of the specific gorilla family you’re tracking. When you meet the gorillas, you’ll have the chance to spend up to one magical hour quietly observing them. The gorillas are likely to be just a few metres away from you and will continue to go about their daily lives - feeding and interacting with each other, under the watchful gaze of the silverback. In the late afternoon, you’ll be transferred back to your accommodation where you can spend the evening reflecting on your incredible encounter with the wild mountain gorillas of Uganda.

Fly to Murchison Falls National Park - This morning, you'll enjoy breakfast at the lodge before flying from the nearby Kihihi airstrip to Murchison Falls in northwest Uganda, via a short stopover in Entebbe. This afternoon you will have an opportunity to explore the mighty Murchison Falls either on a boat trip or on foot.

Safari in Murchison Falls National Park - This morning, you can enjoy a game drive on the plains of Murchison Falls National Park, where you’ll have a chance to spot giraffe, spotted hyena, lion, leopard, spotted hyena, buffalo, kob and hartebeest. We also recommend that you take a boat tour on the river towards the base of the waterfalls where it meets the Nile. On the banks of the river, you’ll see hippo, Nile crocodile, elephant and if you’re lucky, the elusive leopard. There is prolific birdlife within the area too, including the extraordinary looking shoebill stork.

Depart Entebbe - Today, you'll have the last morning to enjoy the beauty of Uganda, as your Uganda flying safari experience comes to an end. Following your breakfast at the lodge and a morning safari, you will fly back to Entebbe in time for your connecting international flight home.

tourName: Uganda tailor made holiday
placesVisited: Ngamba Island Chimpanzee Sanctuary, Lake Victoria, Bwindi National Park, Queen Elizabeth National Park, 90% success rate for tracking mountain gorillas, Ishasha Wilderness Camp, Boat trip on the Kazinga Channel, Kibale Forest National Park, Chimpanzee tracking
generalInfo:
Trekking to see mountain gorillas in Uganda is an unforgettable and often humbling experience. These endangered animals have long made Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park their home and being invited into their natural habitat is an absolute privilege, not to be taken lightly.

Elsewhere, Queen Elizabeth National Park provides further examples of Uganda’s wild appeal. This ten day holiday also allows access to a series of national park game drives where tree climbing lions, hippos and elephants can all be found, especially whilst cruising on the Kazinga Channel.

From the chimpanzee sanctuary on Lake Victoria’s Ngamba Island to tracking wild chimps in Kibale Forest National Park, although gorillas are the main draw for wildlife enthusiasts in Uganda their not too distant cousins are never far behind.

Uganda is an incredible location to watch wildlife and this ten day tailor made tour places you in luxury accommodation and with knowledgeable safari guides to ensure your time in Africa is certainly well spent.

One last point: it’s important to understand that this tailor made holiday has a couple of gorilla tracking options to suit this particular itinerary, pending availability. Basically, Volcanoes National Park in Rwanda makes for a worthy substitute if Bwindi is fully booked. Please get in touch for more details.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Entebbe International Airport where you will be met and transferred to your accommodation. Depending on your arrival time, a half day trip to Ngamba Island Chimpanzee Sanctuary can be arranged. Entebbe is a small, quiet town located on the shores of Lake Victoria and is easy to explore on foot or local transport on motorbikes known as “boda bodas”. Visit the Uganda Wildlife Education Centre where you can see and learn about Uganda’s native wildlife, local markets to buy clothes and crafts, curio shops for souvenirs, and the Botanical Gardens on Lake Victoria where you can walk among beautiful trees, watch monkeys moving through the canopy above, and spot many native bird species. Entebbe has a wide variety of restaurants serving many different cuisines as well as several bars and clubs where you can sample the local beer, catch a game of football and chat with the local Ugandans, known for their open and friendly nature. Overnight: The Boma Guest House.

Depart your lodge, for the short drive to the Entebbe domestic airport for your scheduled flight to Kihihi airstrip, near Bwindi/Queen Elizabeth National parks. The flight takes just over an hour (depending on the plane used) and on arrival you will be met and driven to Buhoma Lodge, located at Bwindi Impenetrable Forest. The drive to the lodge is through local villages and mountain roads – lovely scenery and very interesting en route! Guests will have the opportunity for two days of gorilla tracking (pre-booking essential). Other activities that can be enjoyed in and around the park include forest walks, visits to a local school or orphanage or Batwa pygmy village, and curio shopping. Bwindi National Park, located in south western Uganda on the edge of the Great Rift Valley, is considered the most diverse forest in Uganda. The area, one of the few large expanses of forest in East Africa, where lowland and mountain habitats meet, contains a dense ground cover of herbs, vines, and shrubs. Home to over 120 mammals, 345 species of birds, 200 species of butterflies, and 160 species of trees, Bwindi is one of the richest ecosystems in East Africa. The park contains almost one half of the world’s population of the endangered Mountain Gorilla, making it an extremely valuable conservation site. Bwindi is also home to several endangered bird species with very limited ranges, and acts as an important catchment area for many rivers, supplying water for agriculture in the surrounding region. Overnight: Buhoma Lodge

Following breakfast at the lodge, travel to National Park Headquarters to meet your guides for the day and begin your gorilla tracking experience. Experienced guides and trackers will accompany your party on an early morning trek into the dense rain forest on the mountain slopes. The journey, through dense foliage and up steep climbs, is abundantly rewarded with the lifetime experience of viewing mountain gorillas in their natural habitat. You will have an opportunity to be within meters of these magnificent apes, sharing in their daily lives and experiencing their day-to-day activities. Mountain gorillas are extremely rare with only an estimated 850 remaining in the wild. This is an experience you won’t soon forget! Following the trek, return to your accommodation and, if time allows, take a guided afternoon forest or community walk. Please note: tracking may be fairly strenuous with treks up to six hours or longer, at high altitudes, not uncommon. Also, mountain gorillas are wild animals and, as such, sightings cannot be guaranteed. However viewing success rates are over 90%. Overnight: Buhoma Lodge

Those with pre-purchased permits will depart for a second gorilla tracking experience following breakfast at the lodge. Guests not tracking gorillas may wish to enjoy other activities available in the area such as a forest walk, a visit to a local school/orphanage or Batwa pygmy village, and curio shopping. In the afternoon depart Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park and travel (2-3 hours) to Ishasha in the southern part of Queen Elizabeth National Park. Time permitting, during our drive from Bwindi to Ishasha, we may visit a Community Project on the border of Queen Elizabeth National Park. Here the local people allow you to enjoy some time in their homesteads, as well as see some of the crops and curios they produce, and visit the local elephant trench project – which stops elephants coming into the village and raiding crops. Overnight at Ishasha Wilderness Camp

This morning we depart Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park and travel (2-3 hours) to Ishasha in the southern part of Queen Elizabeth National Park. Time permitting, during our drive from Bwindi to Ishasha, we may visit a Community Project on the border of Queen Elizabeth National Park. Here the local people allow you to enjoy some time in their homesteads, as well as see some of the crops and curios they produce, and visit the local elephant trench project – which stops elephants coming into the village and raiding crops. Afternoon game drives will be enjoyed in the Ishasha area, looking for the huge herds of buffalo, elephant, Uganda kob and of course the famous tree-climbing lion typically found in the area. Overnight at Ishasha Wilderness Camp

Spend the day enjoying game drives in the Ishasha sector of Queen Elizabeth National Park. Queen Elizabeth National Park spreads over 1,978 sq km in the western arm of the Great Rift Valley and is home to a wide variety of wildlife including elephants, lions, hippos, buffalo, Uganda kob, baboon, and many species of birds. With both a riverine and savannah habitat, the park includes the southern Ishasha area with its tree climbing lions and Maramagambo, one of the largest surviving natural forests in Uganda. The northern Mweya area, traversed by the equator and dominated by the scenery of crater lakes, is often occupied by large flocks of flamingos. A boat trip from Mweya along the Kazinga Channel, which joins Lakes Edward and George, provides one of the most memorable experiences offered by the park. Overnight at Ishasha Wilderness Camp

In the Mweya area of Queen Elizabeth National Park, also rich with wildlife, visitors will find vast numbers of Uganda’s unique and strange Euphorbia, or “candelabra” tree. The many nearby crater lakes and mountain ranges provide a beautiful backdrop for your journey. Enjoy a leisurely boat cruise along the Kazinga Channel in Queen Elizabeth National Park. You may encounter herds of elephant, buffalos and antelopes, families of warthogs, large groups of hippos, and crocodiles basking on the shore. Kazinga’s shores are a haven for numerous birds, including many migratory species as they make their way south to warmer climates. The cruise also provides a spectacular view of the beautiful Mweya Peninsula and life in local fishing villages set along the banks. Overnight at Mweya Safari Lodge

On this day drive to Kibale Forest – a 2-3 hour drive from QENP (north) on good roads. On a clear day you may get views of the Rwenzoris in the distance. Two nights spent in the area to allow time for chimpanzee tracking in the forest, (permits must be pre purchased). You can also do a forest walk (guided) during your stay, or simply enjoy the area and perhaps visit the Bigodi Swamps, or the Vanilla Farm close to Ndali. All meals included. Kibale is one of Uganda’s enchanting forested parks. Here, you can hike in the park for hours observing the drama of life in a rain forest. The park contains pristine lowland tropical rain forest, montane forest, and mixed tropical deciduous forest. In addition to forest, you will also notice areas of grassland and of swamp. The forest is rich in wildlife. It is most noted for its primate population. Some of these are red-tailed monkey, diademed monkey, olive baboon, chimpanzee, black and white colobus. Some of the other mammals you might see are bushbuck, Harvey’s red duiker, blue duiker, bush pig, and African civet. More difficult to spot are buffalo, waterbuck, hippo, warthog, and giant forest hog. Herds of elephant once travelled back and forth through the area. These elephants have become more and more rare, and now are seldom seen. The birdlike in the forest and grasslands of the forest is abundant. There are almost 300 species, which have been identified here. One particularly worth noting is the endemic to Kibale forest. Overnight at Primate Lodge:

You will either be driven or walk down to the Kibale Forest National Parks’ headquarters to meet your guides for your morning’s chimp tracking experience (depending which lodge you are staying at!). The forest is alive with noise and you should be lucky enough to see the habituated chimps during your trek. Overnight at Primate Lodge:

Depart after an early breakfast for the drive back to Entebbe, stopping for curio shopping on the roadside and a quick photo stop at the Equator. Arriving back in Entebbe, late afternoon in time for your flight home.

tourName: Uganda tailor made safari
placesVisited: Murchison Falls, Queen Elizabeth National Park, Kazinga Channel, Uganda’s wildlife, Safari camps, Lake Mburo National Park
generalInfo:
This Uganda tailor made safari follows a carefully crafted itinerary taking you to some of the most magnificent wildlife parks in the country. With a few days in each of Lake Mburo National Park, Queen Elizabeth National Park and Murchison Falls National Park you will discover not only wildlife spectacles but landscape ones as well. The wildlife spots are also a lot quieter than other safari destinations as Uganda is still very much undiscovered in terms of tourists, and local people will welcome you with open arms.

Highlights include taking a boat along Kazinga Channel which is lined with elephants, buffalo, marabou storks and Nile crocodiles. The vast Murchison Falls National Park is bisected by the River Nile and wildlife cruises here are also unforgettable experiences. You can trek to the top of the Falls too if you like. This is a tailor made trip and so we can fine tune any details to suit your timeframe and interests.

Travelling with your own driver guide and staying at safari lodges or tented camps, you will wake up to the sound of wildlife and birds, and no better place for the latter than at Lake Mburo National Park, the last stop on this Ugandan trip. Because its wetlands and savannah are home to over 350 bird species as well as hippo, buffalo and zebra.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Entebbe International Airport, you will be met by our representative who will welcome and drive you to your hotel for the first night/depending on the time of arrival.
You will spend this time on different game drive in Muchison Falls, here you will enjoy game drives with opportunity to see the big 5.
During this trip to Queen Elizabeth you will have an opportunity to visit the crater lakes, boat ride on Kazinga Channel, and wonderful opportunity to see a varierty of bird species.

Drive back from Queen Elizabeth National Park and on ways stop by and make a quick visit to Lake Mburo National Park, home to number of Zebras. At the end you will be driven to the airport to catch your flight back home.

tourName: Uganda ultimate primate safari
generalInfo:
Uganda is home to several primates with the most outstanding being mountain gorillas and chimpanzees. This safari will combine gorilla trekking experiences and chimpanzee trekking with a visit to the beautiful Queen Elizabeth national park for game drive watching the wildlife in their natural habitat.

Queen Elizabeth national park has some of the best landscapes nestled between the escarpment and Mt Rwenzori. You will enjoy views of crater lakes while on the crater drive in the park. Time spent in the Ishasha sector of the park will increase your chances of watching the tree climbing lions. The lions in Ishasha often climb trees especially in the midmorning to afternoon.

In addition to watching the different wildlife, you will visit a community to interact with the people - it is often said that people come to Africa for the animals but leave with memories of the people they interact with. You will get to impact these communities with your dollars and they will share their lives teaching you a skill or two and even learning about their culture.

dayInfo.description: On arrival at Entebbe International airport, you will be welcomed by our driver guide or hotel representative and transferred to your hotel for overnight.

Drive to Kibale national park after breakfast. Your first stopover is the Entanda community experience for a time exploring Buganda culture. Enjoy tropical fruits, music and dance and tasty Ugandan food. Proceed to your lodge for overnight.

Chimpanzee trekking and Bigodi village walk. Your driver guide will pick you up early to leave for chimpanzee trekking in Kibale national park. This park is home to 13 primates. You will receive briefing from the ranger guide after which you enter the forest in search of chimpanzees. Bigodi village is near the park. For years the human wildlife conflict was high and some of the villagers decided to kill the animals from the park because of going into their gardens. Young people received training and started trails in their village to earn from tourism and therefore be less hostile to the few wild animals that trespassed. In addition this created extra income for a community that only depended on agriculture.

Transfer to Queen Elizabeth national park. Today after an experience in the chimpanzee word, you will be transferred to the beautiful Queen Elizabeth national park. The drive will take you through the crater lake area, enjoy views of the Mt Rwenzori and the different craters. You will visit the Rwenzori founders for sculpture viewing and purchase if this is of interest to you. When you arrive in the park, you will have an afternoon game drive in the picturesque crater drive before retiring to your lodge for overnight.

A morning game drive and afternoon boat safari. You will have an early morning game drive in search of elephants, buffaloes, Uganda Kobs, Lions, waterbucks, warthogs, and elusive Leopards etc. Seeing wildlife in their natural habitat is not a guarantee but a privilege. Spend the afternoon on a boat safari on the Kazinga Channel. Enjoy the boat ride as you watch different wildlife come to the channel for watering. Return to the lodge for overnight.

Transfer to Ishasha Sector of Queen Elizabeth national park: Ishasha is the southern sector of Queen Elizabeth national park and is home to the tree climbing lions. Arrive in the park for a game drive in search of the tree climbing lions.

Transfer to Bwindi forest. Have a slow morning because the drive to Buhoma sector of Bwindi impenetrable national park is not too far. After a morning game drive, return to the lodge for breakfast and later leave for Bwindi Forest.

Uganda Gorilla Trekking in Bwindi impenetrable national park. The trekking happens in this thick forest. Your driver guide will transfer you to the briefing point right at the edge of the forest. After briefing from a ranger guide, you will be allocated a gorilla family which you will be tracking. You will then leave for trekking together with the members of that group. Some gorilla families require that you drive to the starting point of the trek.

Transfer to Lake Mburo national park. This is the smallest savannah park in Uganda. It is home to the beautiful Zebras and Giraffes that are not in Queen Elizabeth national park. Drive from Buhoma to Lake Mburo national park - in the evening enjoy a nature walk in the park.
Horse Riding and Nature walk. After breakfast leave for the a morning nature walk in lake Mburo national park. In the evening, take a horse back safari in the park.
End of Uganda Safari. Have a breakfast and depart for Entebbe International airport for your departure flight.

tourName: Uganda wildlife and activity holiday
placesVisited: Kampala, Jinja white water rafting, Ziwa rhino sanctuary, Masindi Town, Murchison Falls National Park, Fort Portal, Chimp tracking in Kibale Forest National Park, Bigodi Swamp, Rwenzori Mountain range, Queen Elizabeth National Park and game drives, Boat cruise on the Kazinga Channel and into Lake Edward, Gorilla tracking in Bwindi Impenetrable Forest, Lake Bunyonyi, Lake Mburo National Park, Kampala city tour
generalInfo:
This 15-day adventure combines Uganda’s extraordinary wildlife with some exhilarating activities, from white water rafting to bungee jumping. Enjoy a game drive in Murchison Falls National Park, looking out for lions, buffalo and giraffe and take a boat safari on the Nile to the base of the falls, stopping just tens of metres from the ‘Devil’s Cauldron’ and spotting hippos and crocodiles along the way. In the Queen Elizabeth National Park, game drives and a boat cruise into Lake Edward bring you close to the exceptional wildlife, including lion, leopard, giant forest hog, cape buffalo, elephants, waterbuck, topi and hippos. In the southern Ishasha sector of the park there’s the chance to see the legendary tree climbing lions.
